About Portfolio no.nonsense Words

Occasional notes and updates of questionable quality, relevance

Throughout high-school and college, I wrote a lot; I always thought I'd be a storyboard artist or script writer. When I discovered my passion for design, however, I started writing less and less—then nothing at all.

I figured a low-key blog would be the best way to get back into writing real, 140+ character content. Plus, it let's me continue experimenting with Liquid and Markdown.

  • 08/03/2016 Learning Grunt
  • 07/01/2016 Five Pivots
  • 03/02/2016 Startups Don't Need Designers
  • 10/20/2015 Phil the Pigeon
  • 12/15/2014 The Perfect News Website

About

My name is Josh Martin and and I'm a Chicago Designer focused on Branding and UI/UX. Learn more.

A detailed list of my work experience, endorsements, and proficiencies can be seen on my Linkedin and Resume.

I host my unabridged, visual portfolio on Dribbble and offer a brief, consolidated .pdf version for download.

For all other inquiries, I'm reachable via email.

@jawsmartin
